rComments: Brandin has an awesome sense of humor and so much enthusiasm. All of the projects for this class were fantastic and the lectures were super interesting. An A is basically guaranteed.

I took History of Costume and Fashion (an upper division course) in the first quarter of my freshman year. It wasn't super easy, but not terribly hard either. If you study and pay attention in lecture getting an A is totally achievable. Brandin's lectures and projects are fun and I thoroughly enjoyed going to his class.

great class, great professor. you learn about the design of furniture, architecture, interior, fashion, etc. no homework, one midterm, one project, one final. go to class because that's the only place to get the notes and there are little quizzes for points. barely used textbooks. recommended for an easy GE, or a general interest in design!

Brandin is the best. This class is based on his design process, but is a great excuse to spend time on your own work.  Books aren't super necessary for any of his classes, but creativity is.  Very knowledgeable resource, very fashionable, and full of great stories.  His classes are a must!

took 3 classes from him so far- funny and friendly- love it! actually one of the few classes i actually didn't doze off  in in all my 4 years. taking another class from him in my last quarter. love him! history of clothing&costume- didn't use the book, studio- costume design- only used the abling book, 161 commercial design- needed both books!

AWESOME!! amazing professor with a fabulous sense of humor. Taught the material very well, everything was clear and his projects were fun. He seemed to really enjoy & appreciate his students as well. Overall, just a great guy :)

I took him for two classes, 116 and 113. He was an awesome teacher! Great fun to listen to, very entertaining and super nice person. Super helpful for project feed back and lets you work with your own creativity. explains terms very good and clear. the reading was super hard for 113 lots of little facts and detail to know that will come back to you
Prof. Baron is funny, smart, and a good teacher.  The projects are really fun, too!  Take his class if you're interested in design.

Costume Design Studio wasn't as cool as I thought it would be. I felt like I really didn't learn anything and only got a good grade because I already knew how to draw, not because of what I learned. Overall though the class is pretty easy and we got out early every time. You never sew in this class, only draw and paint. Also, you never use the book

Hist. of Costume was an ok class. I found it kind of boring and also confusing as to what we needed to write down from lectures. On the plus side, this class was really easy - the tests consisted of memorizing vocab and there were no papers. DON'T BUY THE BOOKS! I never used them once and got an A in the class. Overall Baron is a pretty funny teach

He gave his notes in a clear manner, it was all easy to understand. His tests and quizzes were all really easy, not long at all. I found that I overstudied for a lot of them. Very helpful with informing us about what might be on the test and such. His projects were cool, creative, etc. He also gave practical information that we might actually use.

I loved this class and loved this teacher! The class was a broad overview of many different kinds of design, so there wasn't anything too complicated to learn. It's important to go lecture because he takes role, there are pop quizes, and he gives you a small homework assignment for almost every class. But there is barely any reading. Take this clas

Professor Baron is awesome. Into to theater and design is interesting and fun. There are lots of notes, but he makes it really clear what you actually have to know. He is really funny and very nice. His class is pretty easy because it is a survey class, but I learned a lot.
